AIMS Module¶

class aims.aims[source]¶

Aims interaction object.

confirm_network_user(idno)[source]¶

Confirm that we’ve created a network user to remove them from the list generated by self.network_users_to_add()

@return: ‘NTD’ (Nothing to do), ‘OK-Enabled’, or ‘OK-Disabled’

get_advisees(netid)[source]¶

@return: A list of advisees.

get_grad_students(searchidno=None)[source]¶

If searchidno is specified, will only return the line that mentions this account. Otherwise,

@return: a csv.reader object of grad students to create. This will be superceded by L{network_users_to_add()} soon.

Example:

>>> from aims import aims
>>> aims = aims()
>>> for row in aims.get_grad_students(): print row
['idno', 'password', 'surname', 'firstname', 'Middle', 'email@wherever.com']
get_idno_from_sn(sAMAccountName)[source]¶

@return: IDNO of sAMAccountName

get_info(idnos, PAGE_LENGTH=3000)[source]¶

@return: A dictionary whose key is idno

get_moodle_roster()[source]¶

@return: This creates and returns a csv.reader object of active course enrollments.

Example:
>>> from aims import aims
>>> aims = aims()
>>> for row in aims.get_moodle_roster(): print row
['row', 'THTR*491*001', 'networkid', 'idno', 'instr@morningside.edu', 'instrIDNO', '[A,D]', '2010/10']

Where [A,D] is an Add or Drop. Null is normal.

get_sn_from_idno(idno)[source]¶

@return: sAMAccountName

idnoxref(user='meyersh')[source]¶

Access the IDNO/Mustang-ID cross reference table.

is_idno(idno)[source]¶

Verify an idno, checking that it’s a 7-digit integer.

network_users_to_add()[source]¶

Retrieve a cvs.reader object from aims from the network_users_to_add.sh script on aims.

Example:

>>> from aims import aims
>>> aims = aims()
>>> for row in aims.network_users_to_add(): print row
['sAMAccountName', 'idno', 'password', 'surname', 'firstname', 'I', 'email@morningside.edu', 'TYPE']
Where TYPE is one of:
  • STUDENTS
  • GRADSTUDENTS
  • ADJUNCT
  • GRADADJUNCT
  • FACULTY
  • STAFF
network_users_to_deactivate()[source]¶

Retrieve a cvs.reader object from aims from the network_users_to_deactivate.sh script on aims.

Example:

>>> from aims import aims
>>> aims = aims()
>>> for row in aims.network_users_to_deactivate(): print row
['sAMAccountName', 'idno', 'reason for deactivation']
network_users_to_update()[source]¶

Retrieve a cvs.reader object from aims from the network_users_to_update.sh script on aims.

Example:

>>> from aims import aims
>>> aims = aims()
>>> for row in aims.network_users_to_update(): print row
['sAMAccountName', 'idno', 'First Name', 'Last Name',
'Network ID', 'Type', 'Ldap Status', 'Email Status']
Where TYPE is one of:
  • STUDENTS
  • GRADSTUDENTS
  • ADJUNCT
  • GRADADJUNCT
  • FACULTY
  • STAFF
and Ldap/Email Status is one of:
  • ENABLED
  • DISABLED
set_pref_email(sAMAccountName)[source]¶

Command aims to set the preferred email to mside standard for a given account
